Gametext: Use 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at one location. Draw one destiny for each character, starship and vehicle the opponent has present. Compare your destiny total to opponent's power total. Player with lowest total loses Force equal to the difference.
Information: Counter Assault can be one of the more powerful cards in the game, if used correctly. The ability to cancel a Force drain is terrific in any circumstance, and the added ability to nail your opponent for additional Force loss makes this card even better. However, there are several factors that make this card a risky proposition. First, there is a possibility that your opponent will match or beat your total, potentially increasing the damage. Also, the Light Side tends to have a higher destiny curve than the Dark Side does. Finally, due to the present rulings, Counter Assaulting in space is a risky proposition at best.
Combo: Counter Assault + Luke? Luuuuke!\par The power reduction on this card can make it easier to have a successful Counter Assault, especially if the Utinni Effect is targeting Luke. \par -----\par Counter Assault + Lateral Damage\par (Indiana Jones Jedi Knight)
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par The total power and number of destinies to be drawn is determined immediately when this Interrupt card begins resolving, and neither changes during the resolution. Thus if a character, starship or vehicle is introduced to the location during resolution of the Assault (such as via Tauntaun Bones) it does not add power and does not permit an additional destiny draw. Similarly, if cards are removed from the location during the resolution (such as by a Program Trap), they will still contribute power and still add a destiny draw for purposes of resolving the Counter Assault. This Interrupt does not cause a battle and thus cards may not be forfeited to reduce Force loss. Remember that, at a system location, characters and vehicles aboard starships are not present at the system. Therefore, for Counter Assault there will ordinarily only be one destiny draw per starship at the system but none for any cards aboard. Counter Assault may technically be played at a holosite but, since there are no characters present (only dejariks and holograms), no destiny will be drawn and zero will be compared to the opponent's total power.
Cancels: A Force drain at one location
IsCanceledBy: Hear Me Baby, Hold Together (V)\par It's A Hit!\par Major Olander Brit\par Surprise Counter Assault

Lore: Jawa adventurer and trader. Famous for taunting a krayt dragon and escaping to tell the tale. Wants to leave Tatooine to explore the galaxy.

Gametext: If two or more stormtroopers are present where the opponent has Jawas, target as many Jawas there as desired. Draw destiny. If destiny > the number of Jawas you targeted, they are immediately lost.

Lore: Repercussions for failure are severe in the Imperial military. Many officers prefer demotion to 'alternative' punishment from Darth Vader.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any Imperial except Vader, Emperor or a stormtrooper. That Imperial is power -2 and its game text is canceled.

Gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2.

Lore: Female companion of Lak Sivrak. A Florn lamproid. Dangerous predator with a poison stinger. Rumored to have mysterious time-shifting attunement to the Force.
Gametext: If present where an opponent's character just fired a weapon, may use 1 Force to utilize Dice's poison stinger (once per turn). Target that character and draw destiny. If destiny = ability, target is 'hit.'

Lore: C-3PO's arm was pulled off by attacking Tusken Raiders. "I don't think I can make it. You go on, Master Luke...I'm done for."

Gametext: Deploy at any interior site. Cannot be moved. Droids may not deploy to same site. Following the turn this device is deployed, all droids present are lost at end of any turn.

Lore: If low on energy and unable to recharge, a droid can shutdown active systems to conserve power.
Gametext: Cancel an attempt by opponent to target your droid to be stolen, 'hit,' lost or captured. Droid is protected from all such attempts for remainder of turn.

Gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 2, also adds 1 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

IsPulled: Blizzard 4\par

Lore: Pilot DS-61-3. Vader's right wingman. Flies Black 3. Reputation for ferocity in combat. Corellian pilot with excellent skills. Nicknamed 'Backstabber.'
Gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 3, also adds 1 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
Information: DS-61-3 personas are:\par \par DS-61-3\par [Death Star Assault Squadron]
IsPulled: Blizzard 4\par

Lore: Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Gold Squadron \b leader\b0  at Battle of Yavin. Prefers Y-wing fighters. Previously led squadron at Renforra Base. Emblem of Specter Squadron on his helmet.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 1, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Adds 1 to forfeit of each other Gold Squadron pilot at same location.
IsPulled: Princess Organa\par Yavin 4: Massassi War Room (V)

Lore: Ambulatory power generator made by Veril Line Systems to support equipment and vehicles. Slow-witted. This EG unit is memory-wiped and doesn't know its name or serial number.
Gametext: Adds 1 to power of each of your droids present, except power droids. * Destiny equals zero, but if drawn as a battle destiny where you have less power than opponent, your total power present is doubled (once per battle).

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par This droid works just like EG-4, adding 1 to power of each of your droids present. See EG-4.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par EG-4 (Eegee-Four)\par When this droid is drawn as battle destiny, it doubles total power (but not attrition) present at the location of the battle before adding any other battle destiny draws.

Lore: Enhances distant targets using a computer-assisted zoom technology. Provides range information. Works in low-light. Rugged case protects the internal systems.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on any warrior. At any time, you may peek at the top card of your Reserve Deck by using 2 Force. You may choose to move that card to the top of your Force Pile.
IsPulled: Corporal Beezer\par Portable Scanner

Lore: A Givin pilot who can seal his joints to withstand the vacuum of space. Makes slaving and spice runs to Kala'uun. Has made many special modifications to his ship, the \ul Hinthra\ul0.
Gametext: At any time (except during battle), target any or all of your characters at one site to 'transport' (relocate) to any one other site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
Information: Lana Dobreed (Coruscant U) has same function, but is limited to players move phase and can only transport from exterior sites.\par -----\par Lobel (DS) / Sic-Six (LS) prevent characters from moving to or from same or adjacent site using Elis Helrot or Nabrun Leids.\par -----\par Quite A Mercenary is the counter-card against Elis Helrot.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par (Errata) The following actions are part of the initiation of this Interrupt:\par - targeting the characters to be moved;\par - targeting the site to move them to;\par - drawing destiny; and\par - paying the cost (using the Force required to transport the targeted characters).
IsCanceledBy: It's A Hit!\par Quite A Mercenary makes all characters transported by Elis Helrot lost.

Lore: Like many Duros, Madak has natural piloting and navigation skill. Former scout. Freelance instructor. Makes runs to important trade worlds Celanon, Byblos and Yaga Minor.
Gametext: Deploy on your non-pilot character (except droids) to give that character pilot ([Pilot]) skill. Adds 2 to power of anything that character pilots. OR Deploy on your pilot. Adds 1 to power of anything that character pilots. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: Leslomy Tacema (V)\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)

Lore: TIE fighters are stored in large racks far above the hangar deck. Catapulted into space by powerful tractor beam generators, TIEs can quickly scramble to engage the enemy.
Gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle where opponent has more than double your power, reveal up to 3 cards from your Reserve Deck. Of those 3, deploy anywhere (for free) any characters, starships, vehicles, devices or weapons.  Any others are lost.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par Although this card allows you to deploy 'anywhere,' it does not give you permission to ignore deployment restrictions. For example, the Hoth energy shield will still prevent Dark Side deployment to most Hoth sites.

Lore: Capital starships have emergency escape pods. Equipped with food, water, flares, medpacs, hunting blaster and tracking beacon. (R2-D2 deactivated this one's beacon).
Gametext: Save all characters, weapons, and devices aboard any just-lost capital starship. Relocate them to any planet site.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par This Interrupt does not save devices or starship weapons currently deployed on the starship (or on a vehicle or starfighter aboard that starship). You may not relocate your opponent's cards.

Lore: Escape pods are on many starships allowing those in peril to flee, an act considered cowardly by Imperial officers. "We've analyzed their attack, sir, and there is a danger."
Gametext: Unless Tarkin is aboard, save all characters, weapons and devices aboard any just-lost capital starship. Relocate them to any one planet site or one of your capital starships.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par This Interrupt does not save devices or starship weapons currently deployed on the starship (or on a vehicle or starfighter aboard that starship). Saved cards may not be relocated to one of your capital starship cards unless that starship has sufficient capacity to hold all of them and they are all allowed to exist there. (Saved cards may not be relocated to starship sites.) You may not relocate your opponent's cards.

Lore: The Emperor disbanded the Imperial Senate "for the duration of the emergency," seizing absolute power. He planned to extend rule by terrorizing planets into submission.
Gametext: Deploy on any site. 'Expands' your "game text" for that site to add to your "game text" at the adjacent sites.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Expand The Empire + Tatooine: Cantina + Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm + Tatooine: Jundland Wastes\par Deploy Expand The Empire at Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm, and it will add the gametext of that site to both adjacent sites. Now the Cantina is Force Drain +1 (making a total Force Drain of 3), and the Jundland Wastes are Force Drain +1 +1 (making a total Force Drain of 3).\par All this, and at all 3 sites you can add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par This Effect 'expands' game text to the adjacent sites, but it does not expand card titles, marker numbers etc. Thus, for example, it does not allow docking bay transit to or from a non-docking bay site. If Expand The Empire causes a site to have two copies of the same modifier, this does not violate the cumulative rule. For example, if a site has "Force drain +1 here" in its game text and adds another copy of the same game text ('expanded' from an adjacent site), then Force drains are +2 at that site. If game text expanded to an adjacent location contradicts the existing location game text, then the existing game text takes precedence.

Lore: "I don't like the look of this."
Gametext: Deploy beside either player's Lost Pile. That pile is turned face down. Cards from that player's Life Force may not be viewed when they are lost.
Information: Hindsight deployed on C-3PO makes Eyes In The Dark immune to Alter.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-7)\par This Effect causes cards lost from Life Force to be concealed during the process of relocating them to the affected Lost Pile. However, cards lost from hand (or from table) should still be shown to both players before being placed face down on that Lost Pile. Eyes In The Dark does not affect taking or retrieving cards from the Lost Pile in any way (e.g., whenever you wish to retrieve a card using a Baragwin's game text, you may look at the top card to see if it is appropriate).

CardName: Fear Will Keep Them In Line
Lore: "The regional governors now have direct control over their territories. Fear will keep the local systems in line. Fear of this battle station."
Gametext: Deploy on any capital starship. When that starship is at a system or sector you control, your total power is +1 in battles at related sites.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Fear Will Keep Them In Line + Lieutenant Venka

Characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b tax collector\b0
Lore: Corrupt \b tax collector\b0. A male Gotal. \b Bounty hunter\b0. Once sought a bounty on Obi-Wan. Has limited sensing ability to droid emanations. Romanced M'iiyoom Onith.
Gametext: While no droid present with Trevagg, to initiate battles at same location as Trevagg, player must use X Force, where X = total number of (Dark Side Force icon) icons and (Light Side Force icon) icons present.
IsPulled: Double Back
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-7)\par (Errata) This alien resets the cost of initiating battle according to the number of Force icons present with him; thus, if no Force icons are present with Trevagg (e.g., at the Death Star: Trash Compactor or whenever Trevagg is in an enclosed vehicle or starship), battles may be initiated for zero Force. Since reset values are unmodifiable it cannot be affected by cards such as Wars Not Make One Great (though actions that are "free" remain free).
IsCanceledBy: Game text is canceled by Freon Drevan.

Lore: A male Bith. \b Musician\b0  who leads the Mos Eisley Cantina band, Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes. Expert \b gambler\b0  and card shark.
Gametext: Once each turn during your control phase, you may use 1 Force to make a 'wager.' Draw three destiny. Opponent draws two destiny. Player with highest total may randomly select one card to be retrieved from that player's Lost Pile.

Lore: Overcrowding in heavy fire zones increases chances of accidentally shooting one's own comrades. Stormtroopers never let accuracy get in the way of victory.
Gametext: An accident occurs at the beginning of a battle at any site where opponent has at least two characters and one weapon. Draw destiny. If destiny < number of opponent's characters at that site, one is lost. (Opponent's choice.)
Information: Combo card: Alter & Friendly Fire

Lore: Imperial stormtroopers adopt strict security measures. Excellent communications and sheer numbers can hinder Rebel movement across entire territories.
Gametext: Use 2 Force. Draw Destiny. If destiny < number of Stormtroopers on the table, all opponent's movement is blocked for the remainder of this turn (except for smugglers and the starships they are aboard).
Information: Quarren at a planet site makes Full Scale Alert an Used Interrupt.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-7)\par Cards that have their movement 'blocked' by this card cannot move.

Lore: Rebel pilots use visual scanning to supplement sensors for an edge against Imperial fighter pilots. Natural instincts allow lone Rebels to overcome superior numbers.
Gametext: If your pilot (or permanent pilot) is defending a battle alone at a system or sector, add one battle destiny. OR If Luke is defending a battle alone at a system or sector, add 1 to power and add one battle destiny.

Lore: Installed at many facilities throughout the Empire to provide power to the Imperial spacefleet. Supplies starships with energy necessary for sub-light and hyperspace travel.
Gametext: Deploy on your starship at a system or sector where a related docking bay is on table. Adds 1 to hyperspeed, power and maneuver.

Lore: Uses standard fusion technology. Provides starships with energy for hyperspace travel. Installed at docking bays and throughout the Outer Rim Territories.
Gametext: Deploy on your starship at a system or sector where a related docking bay is on table. Adds 1 to hyperspeed, power and maneuver.
IsPulled: Corporal Beezer\par Portable Scanner

Lore: Notorious 'gaffi' weapon favored by Tusken Raiders. Built from scavenged metal. Intimidates and evokes fear.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any Tusken Raider. If a battle has just been initiated where present, target a character for free; draw two destiny. If total destiny > 5, target's weapons are 'knocked away' (may not be used this battle).

Lore: Long-nosed, male Kubaz from Kubindi. \b Spy\b0. Squealed on Obi-Wan and Luke outside Docking Bay 94. Works for Jabba the Hutt or the highest bidder. Not particularly brave.
Gametext: When at same location as a Rebel of ability > 2, deploy -1 there for any Imperials, and during your move phase, Imperials at an adjacent site may move there for free.
IsPulled: Murttoc Yine
Combo: Garindan + Nevar Yalnal

Lore: Skilled tactician and natural \b leader\b0. Planned attack on Death Star after analyzing technical readouts provided by Princess Leia. Star Destroyer captain during Old Republic.
Gametext: Increases Rebel Planners by 1, doubles if at same site. May use 1 Force to cancel Wrong Turn. Each Rebel present with him at a Yavin 4 site is power +1.
IsPulled: Balanced Attack\par Princess Organa\par Rebel Leadership (V)\par Strike Planning\par Yavin 4: Massassi War Room (V)
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-7)\par When this Rebel "increases Rebel Planners by 1," he adds 1 to X; when he "doubles" it, he doubles X instead. General Dodonna does not affect the deploy cost of Rebel Planners.

Lore: Oversees defense operations of Death Star. Outstanding tactician. No-nonsense \b leader\b0. Member of House of Tagge, a powerful noble family and corporate conglomerate.
Gametext: Tagge's forfeit +1 for each Imperial trooper, of any kind, present with him at a site.

Gametext: If Luke and Obi-Wan or Yoda are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR Use 1 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take any one lightsaber into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.

Lore: \b Leader\b0. Governor of Outer Rim Territories. Commanded Death Star. Helped disband Imperial Senate. Defined doctrine of rule by fear. Plotted to use Death Star against Emperor.

Lore: Tatooine's twin suns cause turbulent storms that strike with little or no warning. Strong winds whip rocks through the air with enormous force.

Lore: Things went from bad to worse when Luke was attacked by a dianoga, a parasitic predator native to the planet Vodran.
Gametext: If It Could Be Worse was just played, it is canceled and you may use X Force to raise damage against opponent by X amount. OR If opponent just lost Force from a battle, play to increase loss by 1 Force.
Information: Combo Card: Ommni Box & It's Worse
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-9)\par When this Interrupt increases your opponent's Force loss, this is simply a modifier; it does not create a new, separate instance of Force loss. It Could Be Worse is played during the result step of a Force loss action, and therefore the chance for optional responses to that Force loss action has already passed. For example: the Dark Side player Force drains for 2. The Light Side player has no response to the Force drain (neither does the Dark Side player) and the Force drain now has its result. The Light Side player now plays It Could Be Worse and uses 2 Force. The Dark Side player responds to It Could Be Worse by playing It's Worse and using 5 Force. Neither player has any responses to the It's Worse (the Light Side player doesn't have his Sense in hand) and thus it has its result. The Force drain loss is now 7 Force and Light Side cannot play his Control because the optional response step to the Force drain is already over.
Cancels: It Could Be Worse

Your opponent's use of Force is mandatory. If both players do not have sufficient Force available, the Jawa may not be deployed. Any modifier to such a Jawa's deploy cost affects both players. If a Jawa's game text gets canceled, the asterisk (*) in its deploy box becomes undefined and is treated as an "unmodifiable zero" (see undefined values).

Previous text:\par Use 1 Force at the beginning of your battle phase to allow any two Stormtroopers in the Cantina to battle any one opponent's character (your choice). You may add one battle destiny. No other battles may occur in Cantina this turn.
Rules: Local Trouble Battle\par A Local Trouble battle is one where a battle has been initiated by a card titled Local Trouble. During a Local Trouble battle, any other characters, vehicles, or starships at the site that are not participating in the Local Trouble battle are inactive for the duration of the battle, with two specific exceptions:\par *If a character participating in a Local Trouble battle is on an open vehicle, that vehicle is not inactive.\par *Cards that become inactive because of a Local Trouble battle are considered to be on table for the purposes of objectives.\par Remember that these cards are inactive by rule, they are not considered excluded for any game-related purpose.

Information: There is no dark counterpart, but Sacrifice has similar text.\par -----\par One of the most useful Effects in the game for the Light Side. With Mantellian Savrip on table, you need not lose characters from the site/system, but satisfy that damage by losing a character or starship from hand.\par One major problem is that most Dark Side players run a copy of Masterful Move in their decks.\par -----\par Hindsight deployed on C-3PO makes Mantellian Savrip immune to Alter.

Combo: Mantellian Savrip + BG-J38\par Adds 2 to the destiny of each of your holograms and dejariks drawn for battle destiny or weapon destiny.\par -----\par Mantellian Savrip + Brainiac\par Brainiac's forfeit is equal to the total number of cards in your opponent's hand, so he often may be sacrificed to the Mantellian Savrip to cover all battle damage and attrtion against you.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-11)\par This Effect allows you to forfeit cards that have a forfeit value directly from your hand during the damage segment of a battle you have lost. This is treated the same as normal forfeiture, satisfying battle damage and/or attrition (simultaneously if both need to be satisfied). Cards forfeited from hand with Mantellian Savrip must be placed in the Lost Pile regardless of any other game text. For example, a character may not be forfeited from hand to the Bacta Tank, and the Star Cruiser Liberty may not be forfeited from hand to the Used Pile.
IsCanceledBy: Masterful Move\par Masterful Move & Endor Occupation\par Suspended by Cold Feet (V) for remainder of turn.

Lore: A regenerating, primitive, violent, desert dwelling, fearless, mercenary-joining Lirin Car'n-befriending, cyclopian Abyssin from Byss. Calling him 'monoc' will start a fight.

His ability 1 makes him a prime target for weapons fire (especially sabers which may drop his forefeit to 0). Obi Wan (and those with his cape) loves messing with Myo's mind and can easily send him away from the battle where he was needed. Finally, his deploy cost of 4 makes him difficult to get out of your hand.
Combo: Myo + Bounty Hunters = Protect your low forefeit bounty hunters by throwing Myo in the way. \par -----\par Myo + Lone Warrior + Moment of Triumph = You only lose the destiny adders.

In such cases, this Interrupt simply 'fails' and is placed in the Lost Pile.

Information: Good tracking will make the Light Side lightsaber wielding Jedi lost.

This interrupt may also target a character with a permanent weapon icon; however, it only has an effect if the destiny draw = 0 (character with weapon is lost).

Lore: Guardian of Luke Skywalker. Husband of Beru Lars. Brother of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Farmer of moisture. Disapprover of Luke's desire to leave Tatooine.

Lore: Cornered by Imperial troops, Han's gambler reflexes led him to do what comes naturally - attack! Surprise assaults work...sometimes.

Gametext: While aboard a non-creature vehicle, adds 1 to power, maneuver and landspeed. May drive transport vehicles.

Lore: "...bring me the passengers. I want them alive!" Imperial soldiers use blaster stun settings to intimidate or to capture prisoners for questioning and interrogation.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to target one opponent's character. Draw destiny. If destiny > character's ability, character immediately returns to opponent's hand. (Also, any cards deployed on character return to owners' hands.)
Information: Sometimes just getting rid of a character for even one turn can be a benefit. How many of you have lost a game by just a few cards? Pretty much everyone right? Those are the kind of games where you say, "Boy just one little change and I would have two points instead of zero." Well let's talk about some scenarios where getting rid of a character for a turn would make a difference. And keep in mind that when you send them back is just as important as who you send back. \par \par A good target for Set For Stun is where the opponent has just enough ability to get a destiny draw. They have Owen and Beru at the Moisture Farm. Beru has ability of one, send her back to the opponent's hand and they have gone from four power and nine forfeit, to 1 power and four forfeit. Now deploy some characters and battle away, free of the uncertainty of a destiny draw. \par \par How about getting rid of that Undercover Spy that's blocking your Force Drain of two or three. Play Set For Stun during your control phase and drain away. It's not as permanent as Sniper, but it only requires one card.
IsPulled: Lieutenant Cecius\par Sy Snootles (V)
Combo: Set for Stun + Scanning Crew\par Send a Rebel back into the hand then scan it right into the Used Pile. \par -----\par Set For Stun + M'iiyoom Onith

IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Imperial troops with strict orders are often caught off-guard by innovative Rebel ambushes, sneak attacks, or sabotage efforts.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at one location. Draw one destiny for each character, starship and vehicle the opponent has present. Compare your destiny total to opponent's power total. Player with lowest total loses Force equal to the difference.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par See Counter Assault.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par Counter Assault\par The total power and number of destinies to be drawn is determined immediately when this Interrupt card begins resolving, and neither changes during the resolution. Thus if a character, starship or vehicle is introduced to the location during resolution of the Assault (such as via Tauntaun Bones) it does not add power and does not permit an additional destiny draw. Similarly, if cards are removed from the location during the resolution (such as by a Program Trap), they will still contribute power and still add a destiny draw for purposes of resolving the Counter Assault. This Interrupt does not cause a battle and thus cards may not be forfeited to reduce Force loss. Remember that, at a system location, characters and vehicles aboard starships are not present at the system. Therefore, for Counter Assault there will ordinarily only be one destiny draw per starship at the system but none for any cards aboard. Counter Assault may technically be played at a holosite but, since there are no characters present (only dejariks and holograms), no destiny will be drawn and zero will be compared to the opponent's total power.
Cancels: Surprise Assault may not be played when The Way Of Things on table.
IsCanceledBy: Boring Conversation Anyway\par Cold Feet (V)\par Counter Surprise Assault\par Tarkin's Orders

Lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
Gametext: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Tagge (or warrior) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an "all cards" situation). Seeker is also lost.
Information: Attark:\par When at a site you control, allows your Seekers to deploy free there. Attark also allows your Seekers to move for free and to ignore any or all potential target(s) whenever you choose.

Lore: Takeel, a burned-out Snivvian mercenary known as a double-crosser. Spice addicted. Frequents the Cantina looking for work, but has also turned lawbreakers over to the Empire.
Gametext: If both players just drew one battle destiny, use 1 Force to switch numbers.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par This Interrupt may be initiated only after all destiny draws are performed by both players. Thus, this action requires that both players draw exactly one battle destiny each. For all intents and purposes, the two destiny numbers trade places. Any further actions or modifiers which affect a player's destiny (e.g., Han's Dice) will affect that player's new number.

Lore: Maneuver named after Adar Tallon, tactician of the Old Republic who revolutionized starfighter combat. Pursuing fighter rolls and turns, maintaining speed and target lock.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par (Errata) You may use this Interrupt to target an unpiloted Rebel starfighter. If both players have the same total, neither starfighter is lost.

This capability may be used even if Talz has been 'hit' (the forfeiture of Talz satisfies both 'hits'). Neither the Talz nor the original target is affected by any other results of the weapon, such as "forfeit = 0" or "may not be used to satisfy attrition."

Gametext: During your control phase, you may move free from here directly to Cantina (or vice versa).
LightSideText: During your control phase, you may move free from here directly to Cantina (or vice versa).
Information: Tatooine: Mos Eisley is the cornerstone for a Tatooine ground Force drain deck. The key to this strategy is to stay away from the Dark Side ground forces while continuing to force drain. Eventually, an opportunity usually presents itself to make a crippling counter-attack. This site, when combined with Tatooine: Cantina, form a strong site combination.\par \par Of primary importance is the ability to move Light Side characters for free during the control phase. This affords the Light Side player a number of large strategic advantages. First, this provides excellent force generation and Force drain opportunities. That the Dark Side gains some force generation is somewhat negated by the fact that they will have to play a sufficient Force at both sites to force a battle. With the Tatooine: Mos Eisley game text, avoiding the Dark Side task force is free, while the Dark Side player must pay to chase from site to site. The Light Side player can keep her entire force strong and protected at one location and still Force drain at both sites. If the Dark Side has no presence at either site, and the Light Side has at least two characters deployed at one of the sites, just move one character to the second site, execute both Force drains, and then move the rest of the characters over. Keep in mind that this counts as their movement for the turn.\par To completely halt the force drains, the Dark Side will have to split her forces between the two sites. When it is advantageous, the Light Side player can use the free move in the control phase to move her whole Force over and attack immediately.\par \par Two types of cards will augment this deck greatly. First, the Light Side player must keep the Dark Side from deploying and immediately initiating a battle. Narrow Escape and Rebel Barrier can both help with this, and the A NEw Hope cards I Have a Very Bad Feeling About This and R2-D2 with a Fire Extinguisher work as well. If the battle does start, Houjix can keep the results from being crippling by eliminating force loss. Lightsabers and Lightsaber Proficiency increase the Force drain at the sites, also a key. Quite a Mercenary will keep the Dark Side from launching a surprise attack via Elis Helrot. Include multiple Tatooine: Mos Eisley to keep them from being reversed.\par \par Cards to watch out for: Dark Side Tatooine: Mos Eisley, Counter Assault.
IsPulled: A Weakness Can Be Found\par Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan\par Mindful Of The Future\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
Combo: Tatooine: Mos Eisley + Tatooine: Cantina\par Keep the Dark Side troops away and Force drain while awaiting an opportune time to counter attack.\par -----\par If you're going to play with Tatooine sites, these are a must. Cantina is a 2/2 site and Mos Eisley lets you move to and from there for free during your control phase.\par So, stack your characters on one of those two sites to better withstand a battle, then on your control phase move some of them over to the other, drain at both, and then move the ones you didn't move yet to re-consolidate your forces.\par -----\par Tatooine: Mos Eisley + Spaceport Speeders\par Once you're there movement is free, so you don't need the speeder anymore. Why not sell it for 2 or 3 destiny worth of force?\par -----\par Fun Combo: Everybody likes bar games. Toss down a Holoboard and play a little Dejarik while throwing back a little Blue Milk in the Cantina.

Gametext: Everything in Trash Compactor is crushed (Lost).

Lore: Threepio's many misadventures often threatened his continued operation. The luckless protocol droid developed a healthy sense of cynicism, and a keen grasp of the obvious.
Gametext: If you have less than 15 Life Force, play during opponent's control phase. For remainder of turn, each time you must lose Force, the loss is cut in half (round up). If R2-D2 or C-3PO on table, round down.
IsPulled: Hopping Mad
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par This Interrupt is not a response to a Force drain.\par -----\par When applying this automatic force reduction modifier in combination with other automatic modifiers (such as Honor of the Jedi) the halving from We're Doomed is applied first before the other cards take effect. This is a specific exception to the rule that all automatic modifiers are applied to a value instantaneously.

Lore: Standard treadwell droid. This one, also known as 'Eyesixsixtoo', is typical of the thousands of droids which repair and maintain heavy machinery and starfighters.
Gametext: Adds immunity to attrition < 2 to all your vehicles and droids at same location. Also, if 'treadwell' droid is at a docking bay, adds immunity to attrition < 3 to all your starfighters at the related system and related sectors.

Lore: Unique treadwell droid cobbled together by Jawas. Now owned by the DeMaals, proprietors of Docking Bay 94. Nicknamed 'bantha' for its slow and stubborn personality.
Gametext: Adds immunity to attrition < 2 to all your vehicles and droids at same location. Also, if 'bantha' droid is at a docking bay, adds immunity to attrition < 3 to all your starfighters at the related system and related sectors and may cancel Lateral Damage.
IsPulled: Echo Base Garrison
Cancels: Lateral Damage

Lore: Bought Luke's landspeeder for Spaceport Speeders. A Vuvrian female. \b Gambler\b0  who owes Jabba 1,000 credits in wagering debts. Speaks many languages.
Gametext: During your control phase, may use 1 Force to target an opponent's unoccupied transport vehicle or droid present. Draw destiny. If destiny > target's destiny number, use Force equal to target's deploy cost to 'purchase' target (use as if stolen).
Combo: Deploy her at the Cloud City: Incinerator and couple her with Spaceport Speeders and an R2-X2 (Artoo-Extoo) and you have a great combination which allows you to activate a lot of Force without losing any cards. Place her in a Cloud City Sabacc based deck and you have a gambler and a great draw during Sabacc games.\par ------\par Wioslea + Cloud City: Incinerator + Spaceport Speeders + R2-X2 (Artoo-Extoo) \par Create a great Force generator! \par ------\par Wioslea + Cloud City Sabacc\par Helps you win Sabacc games!

Lore: Imperial troopers use tactics to strand and cut off fugitives. Only daring and unpredictable actions gave Luke and Leia a chance to escape.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on opponent's side of table. All opponent's warriors are deploy +1.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Gruff, surly, no-blasters-allowed bartender. Hates droids. "We don't serve their kind here." Wants to concoct the perfect drink for Jabba so he can work as his personal bartender.
Gametext: If at the beginning of your control phase any weapons or droids are present at same site, all of them are lost. If in the Cantina, all weapons and droids there are immediately lost.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par This alien's capability to cause weapons and droids to be lost is an automatic action.

Lore: Model T-65 by Incom Corporation. Delivered to Alliance by defecting design team. 12.5 meters long. Wings deploy in an 'X' position for better weapons coverage.
Gametext: Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
IsPulled: All Wings Report In\par Organized Attack
Combo: X-wing + Organized Attack

Lore: Rebel sentries are stationed on raised sensor platforms. On watch for Imperial scouts and other hazards, they supplement data gathered by Yavin Base's main sensors.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy at any Yavin 4 site. Declare one of the following to affect that site and adjacent sites while 'sentry' present: Opponent's deploy +1. OR Opponent's ability required for battle destiny +1. OR Your total power +1.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Combo: Yavin Sentry + Grondorn Muse

Lore: An Imperial bureaucrat with high security clearance who resigned and fled in remorse after the occupation of his home planet, Ralltiir. Now a fugitive from the ISB.
Gametext: Deploy at any location. You may move Mig like a character. Target an opponent's character, who may apprehend (cancel) Mig by reaching same location. Until then, during all battles at same and adjacent sites to Mig, opponent's total power is -1.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par This Utinni Effect is not a character and may not be targeted as a character. Yerka Mig deploys and moves like a character, but does not require presence or Force icons and does not count toward vehicle or starship capacity. While at a system or sector location, Yerka Mig does not affect the opponent's power.

Lore: "Evacuate? In our moment of triumph?"
Gametext: If an opponent has just initiated a battle, triple the resulting battle damage for the eventual loser. OR Triple the result of Don't Underestimate Our Chances.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-17)\par See Don't Underestimate Our Chances.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par Don't Underestimate Our Chances\par This Interrupt does not triple attrition.
IsCanceledBy: He Can Go About His Business - Defensive Shield\par He Can Go About His Business (V) - Defensive Shield

Lore: "With this blast shield down, I can't even see. How am I supposed to fight?"
Gametext: Deploy beside either player's Lost Pile. That pile is turned face down. Cards from that player's Life Force may not be viewed when they are lost.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-17)\par See Eyes In The Dark.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-7)\par Eyes In The Dark\par This Effect causes cards lost from Life Force to be concealed during the process of relocating them to the affected Lost Pile. However, cards lost from hand (or from table) should still be shown to both players before being placed face down on that Lost Pile. Eyes In The Dark does not affect taking or retrieving cards from the Lost Pile in any way (e.g., whenever you wish to retrieve a card using a Baragwin's game text, you may look at the top card to see if it is appropriate).

CardName: Your Powers Are Weak, Old Man
Lore: "You should not have come back."
Gametext: During any battle involving both Vader and Obi-Wan, you may add one battle destiny. OR Destroy (cancel) either: Return Of A Jedi, Jedi Lightsaber, Jedi Presence or Old Ben.
Cancels: Jedi Lightsaber\par Jedi Presence\par Old Ben\par Return Of A Jedi

Lore: Rugged Rebel Alliance fighter. BTL-S3 has room for a second pilot to assist weapons operations. 16 meters long. Built by Koensayr.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
